items.title: COVID-19 Rental Assistance For Sonoma County Renters and Landlords
items.summary: Renter households having trouble paying rent or utilities due to COVID-19 job loss or reduced hours; have a COVID-19 positive exposure or diagnosis.* Landlords who have tenants behind on rent due to COVID-19 job loss or reduced hours; or have a COVID-19 positive exposure or diagnosis.

items.title: COVID-19 Asistencia de Renta para Inquilinos Propietarios en el Condado de Sonoma
items.summary: Hogar de inquilinos con dificultades   pagando renta  o servicios públicos de hogar a causa de pérdida de trabajo o horas  reducidas en relación a COVID-19; si a tenido exposición positiva de  COVID-19 o diagnóstico.*Propietarios de hogar que tienen inquilinos con  renta atrasada a causa de pérdida de trabajo o  horas reducidas en   relación a COVID-19; si a tenido exposición positiva de COVID-19 o  diagnóstico.

items.title: Recomendaciones para celebrar Halloween y Día de los Muertos de forma segura durante la pandemia de COVID-19
items.summary: El virus COVID-19 sigue circulando en las comunidades del Condado de Sonoma, causando enfermedades graves, hospitalizaciones y muertes entre nuestros residentes.

items.title: Guidance for a Safer Halloween and Dia de los Muertos During the COVID-19 Pandemic
items.summary: The COVID-19 virus continues to circulate in communities in Sonoma County causing severe illness, hospitalizations and deaths among our residents. Individuals can spread COVID-19 even without symptoms.

items.title: County of Sonoma provides update on review of school waivers for in-person instruction
items.summary: After careful review of 15 applications, the County of Sonoma Department of Health Services has approved one local school – Presentation School in Sonoma – to move forward with its waiver request to reopen for in-person instruction.

items.title: Sonoma County awards CARES funding to local nonprofits to help residents who need COVID-19 rent support
items.summary: The County of Sonoma has awarded $2.37 million to local nonprofits for Sonoma County residents whose ability to pay rent has been impacted by COVID-19, as well as to low-income landlords who have lost income as a result of COVID-19.

items.title: El condado de Sonoma otorga financiamiento para agencias locales sin fines de lucro con el fin de ayudar a los residentes impactados por el COVID-19 que necesitan apoyo para pagar el alquiler
items.summary: El condado de Sonoma ha otorgado $2,37 millones a agencias locales sin  fines de lucro para los residentes del condado de Sonoma impactados por el COVID-19  que necesitan apoyo para pagar el alquiler, y también para los propietarios de bajos  ingresos que han perdido ingresos debido al COVID-19.

items.title: October 2, 2020 at 5 p.m. - Community Briefing on Glass Fire
items.summary: Sonoma County, City of Santa Rosa and Cal Fire officials, will hold a joint press conference at 5 p.m. today,  October 2, 2020 to provide updates on the Glass Fire and Covid-19 in Sonoma County. .

items.title: October 1, 2020 at 5 p.m. - Community Briefing on Glass Fire
items.summary: Sonoma County, City of Santa Rosa and Cal Fire officials, will hold a joint press conference at 5 p.m. today, Thursday, October 1, 2020 to provide updates on the Glass Fire and Covid-19 in Sonoma County. .

items.title: Sonoma County, City of Santa Rosa and Cal Fire officials to hold 5 p.m. briefing on Glass Fire, Covid 19
items.summary: Sonoma County, City of Santa Rosa and Cal Fire officials, will hold a joint press conference at 5 p.m. today, Wednesday, September. 30, 2020 to provide updates on the Glass Fire and Covid-19 in Sonoma County.

items.title: Los funcionarios del Condado de Sonoma, la Ciudad de Santa Rosa y CalFire, realizarán sesiones informativas sobre el incendio Glass a las 5 p.m.
items.summary: Los funcionarios del condado de Sonoma, CalFire, y la Ciudad de Santa  Rosa, realizarán unas conferencias de prensa mutua a las 5 p.m. hoy,  miércoles 30 de septiembre, para proporcionar una actualización sobre el  estado del incendio Glass y Covid-19 en el condado de Sonoma

items.title: La Plaza to lead response to disproportionate impacts of COVID-19 on Latinx and indigenous communities in Sonoma County
items.summary: The Sonoma County Department of Health Services’ Latinx Health Work Group has selected the nonprofit group On The Move to develop and implement a large-scale outreach and education campaign in response to the adverse and disproportionate impacts of COVID-19 within the local Latinx and indigenous communities.

items.title: La Plaza dirigirá la respuesta al impacto desproporcionado de COVID-19 en las comunidades latinxs e indígenas en el Condado de Sonoma
items.summary: El Grupo de Trabajo de Salud Latinx del Departamento de Servicios de  Salud del Condado de Sonoma ha seleccionado la entidad sin fines de  lucro On The Move para desarrollar e implementar una campaña a larga  escala de enlace comunitario y educación en respuesta al impacto adverso      y desproporcionado de COVID-19 en las comunidades latinxs e indígenas  locales
